Project Modules¶

sms_app.views.index(request)[source]¶

Display the main dashboard with a list of all students.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered template with all student records.

sms_app.views.add(request)[source]¶

Add a new student to the system. If the request is POST and the form is valid, saves the student data to the database.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered form for adding a student with optional success message.

sms_app.views.register(request)[source]¶

Register a new user. On successful registration, logs in the user.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered registration form or redirect to index after success.

sms_app.views.login_view(request)[source]¶

Authenticate and log in a user. If credentials are invalid, returns form with error messages.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered login form or redirect to index upon success.

sms_app.views.logout_view(request)[source]¶

Log out the current user and redirect to the login page.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Redirect to login page.

sms_app.views.view_student(request, id)[source]¶

Display details for a specific student.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • id – Primary key of the student to display.

Returns:

Rendered template with the student details.

sms_app.views.edit(request, id)[source]¶

Edit an existing student’s information.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • id – The primary key of the student to be edited.

Returns:

Rendered edit form with existing or updated student data.

sms_app.views.delete(request, id)[source]¶

Delete a student from the database.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • id – The primary key of the student to be deleted.

Returns:

Redirect to index page after deletion.

This function is the model of the system of how it will be formatted

class sms_app.models.UserProfile(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Model

Extends the built-in User model with a one-to-one relationship.

user¶

The associated Django User account.

Type:

User

user¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

class sms_app.forms.StudentForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)[source]¶

Bases: ModelForm

A Django ModelForm for handling input and validation for Student instances.

This form maps fields from the Student model and applies labels and widgets for rendering HTML inputs in the frontend.

Meta[source]¶

Configures the form to use the Student model and specifies field labels and widget styling.

class sms_app.forms.RegisterForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: UserCreationForm

A custom user registration form that extends Django’s UserCreationForm.

Adds an email field to the default registration form and specifies the fields to be displayed.
